title: Sadhu
summary: Sadhu (IAST: sādhu (male), sādhvī or sādhvīne (female)), also spelled saadhu, is a religious ascetic, mendicant or any holy person in Hinduism and Jainism who has renounced the worldly life.[1][2][3] They are sometimes alternatively referred to as  yogi, sannyasi or vairagi.[1]
